location.mountain: Mt. Qingcheng (청성산 / 靑城山) - Located northwest of Chengdu.
landmarks: Tianshi Cave (천사동 / 天師洞) - Where Zhang Daoling preached.
location.geo_political_status: One of the 'Three Great Powers of Sichuan' alongside the Sichuan Tang Family and Emei Sect.

heritage.founder: Associated with Zhang Daoling (장도릉) and the 'Five Pecks of Rice' (Odumi-do / 오두미도).
heritage.history: Started with Taoist arts (Bangjung-sul, Talismans) and evolved by absorbing local assassin/poison arts.

status.reputation: A prestigious member of the Nine Great Sects, but often ranked lower than Wudang or Shaolin due to their usage of 'petty' tricks (hidden weapons).

characteristics.archetype: Pragmatic Taoist / Sword & Hidden Weapon User

combat_style.summary: Fast Swords (Pine & Wind) combined with Surprise Attacks (Hidden Weapons).
combat_style.specialty: Unlike Wudang (Pure Taoist), Qingcheng incorporates 'Unorthodox' methods like poison palms and projectiles.
combat_style.tactics: Overwhelm with sword speed (Wind), then finish with a hidden needle.

sichuan_triangle.vs_Tang_Family: Rivals in hidden weapons and influence over Sichuan.
sichuan_triangle.vs_Emei_Sect: Rivals for the title of the legitimate Taoist/Buddhist guardian of Sichuan.

signature.name: 송풍검 (Pine Wind Sword / 松風劍)
signature.description: Signature Art. Mimics the sound and speed of wind blowing through pine trees. Fast and sharp.

list.name: 오두미신공 (Five Pecks of Rice Divine Art)
list.lore: Derived from the historical roots of religious Taoism.

list: 만상귀일신공 (All Things Return to One Divine Art)

hidden_weapons.note: The defining trait that separates Qingcheng from other Orthodox sects.
list: 청자구타 (Blue Character Nine Strikes) - Throwing weapons shaped like the character 'Blue' (靑).
취음장 (Gathering Yin Palm) - Suggests Yin/Cold nature.
흑사장 (Black Sand Palm) - Often depicted as a poison palm.
송서초상비 (Squirrel Grass Flight) - Agile and light.

narrative_role: The 'Hypocritical Orthodox' sect that uses dirty tricks when losing.
The generic enemy for the Tang Family (Poison vs Poison/Hidden Weapon).
A sect that keeps ancient Taoist seals (Talismans/Buju) capable of suppressing Jiangshi.
The 'Local Lord' of Sichuan who bullies the protagonist before the main plot begins.
